api_list.name: OpenAPISchemaValidator
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://trivial-functions.p.rapidapi.com/OpenAPISchemaValidator"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "trivial-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: OpenAPISchemaComparer
api_list.description: The endpoint accepts two OpenAPI 3 specifications in YAML format and returns a JSON with their differences

api_list.name: JSONDataToYAMLSchema
api_list.description: This endpoint creates a YAML schema from a JSON data. This is useful for quickly turning a JSON data into schema for embedding inside an OpenAPI 3 spec.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://trivial-functions.p.rapidapi.com/JSONDataToYAMLSchema"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "trivial-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: OpenAPISpecificationUIRenderer
api_list.description: The endpoint accepts an OpenAPI 3 specification in YAML format and returns a Swagger UI rendering in HTML. All the required JS and CSS files are pre-hosted. The HTML can be statically hosted.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://trivial-functions.p.rapidapi.com/OpenAPISpecificationUIRenderer"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "trivial-functions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
